title: Did anyone get a 6X from Wish recently?

thread.text:
Folks,
Some of us caught wind that Wish was offering the Honor 6X (retail value 200) for 2 dollars! That's 1 dollar for the phone and 1 dollar shipping! YES it's coming from China, and who knows what we are actually getting, BUT it was worth a 2 dollar shot! Some folks I know even bought multiples. I have always wanted to try this phone, plus I figure if nothing else it has SOME trade-in value if/when I get my next phone.
So did anyone else take advantage of the deal? Did anyone get there phone yet? According to the tracking mine is flying all around China at the moment! lol
Why would anyone sell a smart phone worth $200 for $2?

replies.text: I guess we will find out in a few weeks! lol Not sure if its, new, refurbished (likely), or a clone/fake. Figured it was worth a 2 dollar chance. If I'm out the 2 dollars, AH WELL!

thread.text: Please let us know how you get on!
Too bad I missed it. I would have bought about 5 at that price. Forget about the trade-in, I could sell them now.

replies.text: This is why this offer seems so suspicious. Why would someone sell phones worth $200 for $2? Anyone care to speculate?

thread.text:
It's a scam! The ad has been changed for new buyers, it NOW says Cover for 6x, BUT look at what it said when *I* bought it! lol
Ah well it was only 2 bucks!
If something looks too good to be true, it probably is.

replies.text: Amen brother! Fortunately it was only a 2 dollar lesson! lol Anyone want a 6X screen protector? 3 dollars! lol

thread.text:
Hi Honor fans,
I recently bought Honor 6X and Chromecast 2 and I would like to connect those and cast my screen to Chromacast 2 connected to my TV. When using MirrorShare, phone is not able to find my TV even it is in the same wifi. I can use Google app Home in which I can recognize Chromecast and cast my screen to the TV but warning that my phone could not be supported is present and when casting quality is really low. In a few seconds screen on TV is sharpened but it is not nice to watch videos, photos on my screen. Did some of you have similar problem and can you provide solution? I'm thinking of other casting app (meaning app that can cast whole screen not just video or photos) but my wife with older phone is able to cast to Chromecast with very nice picture quality, so I want to use official casting way...
Thanks for any help
Daniel
Try turning your Bluetooth off while you cast to Chromecast. This should help since the same antenna is used for both 2.4 ghz wifi and Bluetooth.

Hi everyone. I've recently bought a Huawei Honor 6X, everything was going fine when I realized that my screen was turned off much faster. I went on settings/display to change it but I saw that the option where you can change how much the screen is turned on was "off". You know what I mean, right? I just couldn't select it, I couldn't even press it... What's happening? Please help

Welcome to Android Central! Moved from the Nougat forum to the Honor 6X forum.
Any power-saving modes on? If so, turn them off and see if the problem persists.

Here is the copied message I received from the FB Honor USA page when I asked them the same question. This fixed the problem. 
thank you for contacting Huawei, it will be a pleasure to assist you today. We know this situation can be very frustrating, however, in order to correct it, please consider the following:
- Choose Settings.
- Then scroll down to Advanced settings and hit this option.
- From the following options select Reset all Settings.
- Finally, choose Reset all Settings, and confirm the whole operation tapping Reset all Settings one more time.
- Restart the phone and set the screen timeout again.
- Make a test.
Do not hesitate contact us if you need further assistance or you have any doubts. We wish you a nice day.

I also cannot change the lock screen image.
On Setting > Screen lock > Screen lock style - 
there is only one 'option': "Magazine unlock" with a generic purple image.
I did the reset suggested on this page but it didn't help.

Requirements;
1. Unklocked bootloader
2. Twrp Recovery
Installation;
1. Download the zip file.
2. Reboot to twrp recovery.
3. Flash the downloaded zip file.
DONE...
Download link:Emuicallrecord.zip - 347 kb
Unmark the tick on download with addon then click on download.
Screenshots:https://imgur.com/gallery/1HfyU
Does this record every single call, or is there a way to toggle it on or off before each call?

replies.text: Open dialer , then go to dialer setting , down there is setting for call recording, you can enable or disable it for automatic or manual call recording.....

Sounds like you have your apps set to close after screen lock. Go to battery in settings and switch the apps you want to stay open after screen lock. You may have to turn off data saver as well or whitelist the ones you want to stay on.

thread.text: That's great... How does it compare to the honor 8?

replies.text: Good question

The biggest difference is the feel of the size and non glass build quality. The interface experience is roughly the same and I promise I'd know having owned the honor 8 twice. Real world you hardly can tell any difference in performance or speed. One other difference is that it still runs 4.1 EMUI which I actually liked better than 5.0. Overall the phone feels huge to me compared to the Honor 8. So the biggest difference is feel. Software wise you get the same experience. Don't get me wrong the 5.5 inch screen is nice to have but I just find it to be a bit too large. 5.2 of the Honor 8 is a pretty good balanced screen size for a phone. It's definitely not a one handed device. I've also found it to be plenty zippy enough browsing the internet. Sites open quickly and apps do not lag either. Watching YouTube or a movie on it is much better of course. I'd say the Honor 8 just gives you that premium feel where the 6X does not. It actually seems to be lighter than the Honor 8 which again comes back to feel. For 179 dollars it's got to be one of the best phones for the money out there. I almost went with the Moto G5 plus as it went on sale today for 199. In fact I'm still thinking about it simply because it has a 5.2 inch screen. Then lastly a friend of mine texted me tonight and said he was selling his 128g iPhone SE and that he'd sell it to me for $150. That's a big time killer deal as it's less than a month old and comes complete with box. If I take the 6x back it'll be because of the deal I can get on the 128g iPhone SE. However I know the SE screen size is just too small but being that it's a 128g it'll retain pretty good value which should be well above the 150 I'm paying for it. It's a buddy deal and one I don't think I should pass up. I'll actually save money getting a much better phone. Had I had another honor 8 I'd probably had just passed on it but the 6x just doesn't have the overall premium feel that the Honor 8 has. For 179 for a new device you'll find it hard to find a better phone for the money in regard to the 6x. I just hope my friend doesn't change his mind by tomorrow as I'll use the SE until the Honor 9 is released then sell the 128g SE and buy the honor 9. Plus I've owned the SE twice now so i have several cases for it already. I just can't pass that deal up being that it's a 128g which is way more space than I'll ever need but it's the most expensive SE you can get and at 150 it's a no brainier. I wish I could keep both but only one so if my friend does not change his mind then the 6x I'll return and wait out the honor 9.

title: A thick red horizontal line on my Huawei smartphone screen !

thread.text:
Hello !
2 weeks ago I've bought a Huawei Honor 6x (2016) on eBay.
It's a new budged device with really good specs.
Yesterday, when I was opening YouTube, I noticed a really thick (1mm) horizontal like in the screen. 
The line is not always visible, you can't see it sometimes on homescreen, notification bar, and especially in light background. It's noticeable in max brightness and on some apps, for ex : when you open Instagram you can see it only in the photos that you scroll, not outside the photos, In some apps it doesn't show also when you open recent apps and there's no app to close, it doesn't show, but if there's a list of app to close it will be only half line in the top of the apps.
Sometimes it appears as a full line from left to right, sometimes it's only a short or half line.
Now I'm worried if this is a software (because the line doesn't show always or it least not always a full line) or a hardware problem (dead pixel or LCD problem) ?
I still can return the phone and get a new one, but I was trying to solve it.
Here's a link with some photos I've uploaded : http://imgur.com/a/mUDnE
Waiting for help (an answer).
Best Regards

Welcome to Android Central! It's probably a hardware issue with the screen. Was the phone advertised as brand new, refurbished, or used?
Try booting into Safe Mode: How to turn on safe mode on Huawei Honor 6. If the defect remains, it's either a hardware issue with the screen or (less likely) a firmware problem. I'd contact the seller on eBay and ask for a replacement or refund.
So what happened?

replies.text: Ha true. Anybody have any experience importing phones? Not that I'm planning to, I just see deals come up all the time and am curious about the process of buying on these sites.

I'm glad you asked! Yes I have done it, I got a Mi Mix from Gearbest without issue, also I traded for an International Mate 9 a couple months before the US release. In both cases I knew ahead of time that the devices had LTE in the US. In the case of the Mate 9 all LTE bands from T-Mobile (except the newest that no one has), and in the case of the Mi Mix while it did not have band 12, it did have 2 other T-Mobile LTE bands and I almost always got a good LTE signal.
You need to check what radios/frequencies the device has BEFORE you import it, and you must accept what it has. Additionally there will be no US warranty, and returning the device will be difficult if not impossible.
Gotcha thanks for the info. This is really helpful. Do these phones usually come in other languages? And if so how easy is it to switch it to English?
The question is does it support usa lte and features like volte, wfc, etc. I am sure they are all quad band gsm so technically it would work but internet could be really slow.

True true.  You need to check specifically. SOME phones support some or all of the US LTE bands, but often there are no US LTE bands. As for VoLTE and WiFi calling, often/sometimes T-Mobile supports it on those phones, BUT AT&T almost NEVER does. At least this has been my experience. The key is to check BEFORE you buy and then be satisfied with what you are getting. When I bought my Mi Mix, I did just that. I knew it was missing band 12, but I was ok with that since it had the other LTE bands and WiFi calling DID work.

title: How to turned off Mobile data in sleep mode (Nougat Update)

thread.text:
Hello experts,
I recently bought “Honor 6x”. & I have just updated it to latest “Nougat” update.
Till now, I was using ASUS fonepad. It had a very simple GUI and all the settings were also very simple and straight forward. But now, in nougat update, they have provided a little bit complexity.
I want to turn on my “Data Saver” option. For this, I followed below steps:
Settings -> Mobile Data -> Data saver -> Toggle it to ON
But in this way, my Whatsapp stopped working. It only works if I open it. Means background process stopped.
Even my phone is “ON”, but my Whatsapp stopped working.
SOLUTION: Go to:
Settings -> Mobile Data -> Data saver -> UNRESTRICTED DATA ACESS -> search Whatsapp and toggle it to ON.
Problem solved. Either Whatsapp is currently running OR in background OR your phone is in SLEEP mode, Whatsapp will run smoothly.
But I want that if my phone in ON, data connection should be ON, but if my phone is in SLEEP mode, my Data Connection should be terminated automatically.
After searching, I found Power saving Mode.
Settings -> Battery -> Power saving Mode -> Toggle it to “ON”
Now, Whatsapp is running but Google account auto synchronization has been stopped.
Now, my question is:
1. “Is it possible that after toggling ON the Power Saving Mode, my Google account synchronization should work.”
2. I also toggled the “KEEP WIFI ON DURING SLEEP” to OFF & “KEEP MOBILE DATA ON DURING SLEEP” to OFF, but my data connection is ON either I use WIFI or mobile data. How to turned data connection OFF. As soon as my mobile go to sleep mode.
Thanks,
Anuj Rathi

-Swiping up on the lock screen (just shows flashlight, SMS, etc)
-Searching magazine unlock in settings
-Going in the "Themes" app and pressing Customize>Lock Screen>Magazine unlock (but it just sets the default wallpaper)

Hi Sahil19 
I had the same problem when the OS on my Hawei P8 updated to EMUI 4.1. At first I had the magazine unclock option but I somehow changed the lock screen style by mistake and couldn't get the magazine unclock again. Until I found this following solution. I think it may help you as well. 
Now im not sure if you've got the exact same icons on the bottom since you've got an Honor but obviously Magazine controls aren't there for me anymore. According to the above pic, if you have a section that says "Change screen lock style". Go ahead and click that and it'll take you to the following screen
Now I know that it displays the normal Themes for us to choose from but notice that the first theme says Obsidian(Magazine). It turns out to be that EMUI 4.1 merges the magazine unlock option with one of the themes. Therefore you need to go ahead and select this screen lock style and select the "apply" option as shown on the next picture
Once this was applied, i found that the Magazine controls had once against returned as shown in the next screenshot
I hope that carrying out these steps helps you recover the magazine unlock feature if you haven't already.

Hey there,

Current OS : MM
Model : huawei honor 6x.

Hey Guys,
In this article, I will just quickly summarise the quick specification of Honor 6X phone, which was already launched in October 2016 in China and was recently unveiled during CES 2017 and is all set for a launch on 24th January in India. Let’s quickly start with the specification.Operating System– Android 6.0 with EMUI 4.1.Display– 5.5 InchScreen resolution– 1080 x 1920 pixels with 403 PPIAdditional screen info– 2.5D curved glassDimensions– 150.9 x 76.2 x 8.2 mm (5.94 x 3.00 x 0.32 in)Weight– 162 gCamera:Rear- dual-lens 12MP + 2MP rear camera, PDAF, LED flashFront– 8 MP front cameraProcessor– Octacore Kirin 655 CPU (16nm)Big processor– 4X2.1 GHz A-53Little processor– 4X1.7 GHz A-53SIM– dual nano simRAM– 3GB/4GB*Storage:Internal– 32/64GB*External– 128 GB (uses 2nd sim slot)Battery – Non-removable 3340 mAh batteryAdditional battery info– supports fast charging with 5v/2A (charger provided in box)Connectivity–WLAN– Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, Wi-Fi Direct, hotspotBluetooth– v4.1, A2DP, EDR,USB– micro USB 2.0Sensors – Fingerprint (back side), accelerometer, proximity, compassGPS– A-GPS, GLONASSRadio– FM Radio

Can the fingerprint sensor be used to lock apps.
I saw on one video review that it can be used to lock apps but I've not seen it mentioned anywhere else and another review said it wasn't a feature of the phone.

Hi shangaichica,
at present 4 top apps available to lock apps using fingerprint sensor. App Locker is the first app that you can try on your device. It’s a very basic app with a simple interface. FingerSecurity allows owners of an Android device with a fingerprint sensor to protect their apps with their fingerprints. FingerSecurity allows you to protect any app with your fingerprint. App Locker - Fingerprint: is yet another free app which allows you to protect app with password or PIN. If your mobile has a fingerprint scanner and Android version 6.0 (Marshmallow) then finger print app lock method will also work.AppLock – Fingerprint Unlock: AppLock is yet another app which can protect your apps with a fingerprint. The app can support fingerprint unlock only if your Samsung device or the Android 6.0 device has the fingerprint sensor.
ThanksMotorola Service Center in Chennai
Thank you
Yes it can. go to fingerprint management then access app lock

Ok I figured it out.
plug in the phone
HiSuite starts
On phone "OK" to allow debugging
Then on phone there is a choice between 'photos' and 'files', chose 'files'
HiSuite connects then you can chose SD card or Internal storage in HS and you're in

title: This is a great phone for the money

thread.text:
I picked up one for my wife... I am impressed. This is a nice phone. There are a few quirky things about it, and I cannot understand the lack of NFC and 5ghz wifi. So, I am not suggesting it is a slam dunk... but, nevertheless, I like this phone. 
It looks good. The voice quality is very, very good. The size is just about perfect. The camera(s) are nice and picture quality is also really good. Battery life seems to be stellar. 
After installing the Google Now launcher, it feels like an Android. Stock, it is an iPhone wantabe. 
I wish it had a better display. But, it isn't bad... it just feels budget. 
Thinking about the price point, I'd have to say this is a great phone for the money. I'm glad we purchased it. Once it gets the Nougat update, I am expecting really good things. Including wifi calling on T-Mobile (hint, hint John Legere). 
If you are considering the purchase for a basic smartphone user, this is it.
Thank you for your review! I've definitely heard good things about the Honor 6X. Glad you and your wife are satisfied with your purchase!

I picked one up for my daughter (16, doing my best not to spoil her) and I agree. No real standout features but all around very solid, and whilst it doesn't quite have the specs or build quality of the high end flagships it is well under half the price. Definite thumbs up from me.

replies.text: Good purchasing choice, for sure! And a good phone for a sixteen year-old, in my opinion!

title: Honor 6X- A Real Upgrade To Predecessor Honor 5X?

thread.text:
Hey guys,
* This comparison is applicable for Indian version only as price may not be competitive enough for other regions.
Priced @ 12999 INR for 3GB+32GB, 15999 INR for 4GB+64GB 
Honor 6X just launched in India today, in an event held at Taj palace, New Delhi and the most exciting thing about the launch was the pricing.
Now, as the title goes for this article about Honor 6X- A real upgrade to predecessor Honor 5X, in this article, I will tear down the factors which makes the Honor 6X a real upgrade to its predecessor based on some key features and hardware upgrade. For some background, Honor 5X was launched last year, around the same time, and was a mid-budget flagship phone. Now with the launch of Honor 6X today, with the same price tag of Honor 5X, Honor 6X has really got some key upgrades.
Instead of writing couple of paragraphs here, I will quickly compare the key factors in below table which will give a clearer picture of the comparison and lets you deicide if 6X is an upgrade to Honor 5X.*all the highlighted things are really an upgrade here.
Let’s consider only base Honor 6X variant, based on the above table we can clearly make our decision and can decide for sure if Honor 6X is a real upgrade to Honor 5X with some key factors like upgradable to Nougat with EMUI 5.0 vs the Marshmallow with EMUI 4.1, 3GB vs 2GB RAM, 32 GB internal memory vs the 16 GB internal memory, improved 16nm architecture vs the traditional SD 616 processor, increased 2.1 GHz and 1.7 GHz processor speed vs the 1.5GHz and 1.2 GHz respectively, 3340 mAh battery vs 3000 mAh battery, dual rear camera with improved 8 MP front camera vs the single 13 MP camera with 5 MP front camera, additional 2.5 D glass design vs a regular design and out of the box VOLTE and OTG support. Only thing that is missing here is the dedicated SD card slot from Honor 5X which gives you the luxury of expanding the external memory with dual sim support but thats not a shows stopper here as 32 GB internal memory will fill the gaps.There are many other aspects to compare which can definitely get the Honor 6X a real win win situation here over Honor last years mid budget flagship Honor 5X but that’s how the smartphone technology evolves year on year.
Please post your thoughts on the same in the comment section below.
